intro: Scabiosa tschiliensis f. glabra, commonly known as the silky scabious, is a flowering plant characterized by its soft, woolly foliage and clusters of pink or purple flowers. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The glabra foliage refers to its smooth, hairless leaves, distinguishing it from other varieties of Scabiosa.
